intro: Petrophile triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Petrophile triloba is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
